intro: Cryptantha jamesii var. cinerea, commonly known as the gray cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its small, grayish-blue flowers. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variety is known for its resilience in arid environments and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
